update.description:
A variety of changes needed to score during competition (as opposed to qualification).

To try it:

    roslaunch atlas_utils vrc_task_2.launch

Move/drag the robot through some gates.  There will be a log file, `/tmp/vrc_task_1/score.log`, with content like this:

    # Score data for world vrc_task_2
    # Started at: 1366926176.753
    # Format: 
    # wallTime(sec),simTime(sec),wallTimeElapsed(sec),simTimeElapsed(sec),completionScore(count),falls(count)
    1366926179.891,1.000,0.000,0.000,0,0,""
    1366926182.343,2.000,0.000,0.000,0,0,""
    1366926184.338,3.000,0.000,0.000,0,0,""
    1366926186.419,4.000,0.000,0.000,0,0,""
    1366926188.518,5.000,0.000,0.000,0,0,""
    1366926190.582,6.000,0.000,0.000,0,0,""
    1366926192.617,7.000,0.000,0.000,0,0,""
    1366926194.394,7.877,0.000,0.000,1,0,"Successfully passed through gate 0"
    1366926197.168,8.877,2.774,1.000,1,0,""
    1366926198.848,9.522,4.454,1.645,2,0,"Successfully passed through gate 1"

The elapsed times (3rd and 4th fields) are the times elapsed from passing through the first gate.

That data will also be published along the way on the ROS topic `/vrc_score` in a message of type [atlas_msgs/VRCScore](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/846e683437437b2f68373b3596b9513f6a1609c7/ros/atlas_msgs/msg/VRCScore.msg?at=vrc_scoring_updates).

Arena-specific rules:

* V1: Atlas must pass through the first gate, then the vehicle must pass through the next two gates, then Atlas must pass through the last gate.  1 point per gate.
* V2: Atlas must pass through the gates in order. 1 point per gate.
* V3: Atlas must:
    * pass through the first gate (no points, but starts clock), then
    * get the hose coupler up to around the height of the standpipe (1 point), then
    * get the hose coupler aligned well enough to the standpipe to cause the invisible screw joint to be created (1 point), then
    * rotate hose coupler clockwise until it has traveled at least 1.5cm travel into the screw joint (about 2.38 rotations) (1 point), then
    * open valve by rotating it counterclockwise at least 1 full rotation (1 point).
update.title: Update scoring for VRC

content.raw:
At least in VRC 1 the plugin displays a message saying "Successfully passed through gate 0" when the gate passed hold the sign of number 1. Not in this first case, but could generate confusion in some cases while manually inspecting the logs.

My tests for crossing gates on V1 were just fine. And tried to cheat the system several times was not possible. All looks good. More testing to come in the following days but merge is ok for me.
content.html:
At least in VRC 1 the plugin displays a message saying "Successfully passed through gate 0" when the gate passed hold the sign of number 1. Not in this first case, but could generate confusion in some cases while manually inspecting the logs.

My tests for crossing gates on V1 were just fine. And tried to cheat the system several times was not possible. All looks good. More testing to come in the following days but merge is ok for me.
